data.title: Updating a disabled package automatically re-enables that package
data.body:
I'm not sure how to test this again locally, because I'm not sure how to install an older version of a package.

I had the vim-mode package installed but disabled. I manually clicked the "update package" button (not the "update all" button). After the package had been updated, it seemed that it re-enabled itself. I would have expected it to remain disabled.

Not a large issue but might catch some people out if they had a larger number of disabled packages.

data.title: Please tell me where to rename
data.body: no renameï¼Ÿ

data.title: Update subword regex
data.body:
Fixes #7656 #7658

I added underscore to the snake case/camel case regex segments so that we can skip over it when moving right and left.  In addition, I added non-English letters to the subword regex for better compatibility.

Sorry about combining these into one PR, but I thought it would save time and hassle.

data.title: Fix indentation when pasting lines
data.body:
The fix to ignore invisibles (64dfda572dd3db46ff841db9659f413a5f9b3b21) introduces a new bug when pasting lines from the clipboard:

![before](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4171547/8640040/70538f4e-28ea-11e5-97ab-d39416dcf8fa.gif)

As the commit takes the content of `@buffer.lineFromRow(bufferRow)` to test against the `decreaseIndentRegex`, it will actually test the content of the row the cursor is on instead of the content that is being pasted. And this (of course) could cause unexpected indentations...

In turn the same goes for checking if the `bufferRow` is a commented line, so this check is removed again.

After this commit pasting above a line matching the `decreaseIndentRegex` works as expected again:

![after](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4171547/8640053/139c7a8a-28eb-11e5-9f18-4329950dfc22.gif)

data.title: Cannot use menus in atom on El Capitan

data.title: Default styling for form select elements?
data.body:
Is there a class for `<select>...</select>` elements? 
I am currently using a copy of [this section](https://github.com/atom/settings-view/blob/master/styles/settings-view.less#L78-L87) in the settings-view package.

After waiting a few minutes, the update check succeeds.

data.title: Make holding option while dragging create multiple cursors when
data.body: In Sublime, holding Option (on Mac) while dragging the cursor, creates multiple cursors in a line. I did a quick screen capture of this behavior here: https://youtu.be/71EveOv6tf4. It would be great if the same worked in atom.

data.title: Opening nonexistent file should provide feedback to the user
data.body:
Exactly as the title says, when the user tries to open a file that doesn't exist, they should be presented with some sort of warning message / feedback that it is a new file. If the file name was misspelled, the user could have the false assumption that the file contents were emptied.

Steps to reproduce:
1. File > Open
2. Type random text as the file name and click "Open"
3. Bask in the silence

data.title: Context-menu triggered by menu key is positioned at the mouse cursor
data.body:
Using Atom 1.0.1 on Windows.

When summoning a context menu with the keyboard menu key, expected behavior (from visual studio, sublime, google docs, etc) is for the menu to be rooted at the input cursor. Instead, the Atom context menu is rooted at the position of the mouse cursor.

![atom-cm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10780590/8635149/f51dd40a-27f0-11e5-988d-7057a6106984.png)

In the picture, the context menu should be positioned with the input cursor on the misspelled word.

data.title: ESLint
data.body:
After updating to 1.0.2 I am getting this error, despite ESLint being listed under `node_modules`.

> [Linter-ESLint] Local/Global ESLint binary not found. Fallback to packaged one. Set binary in preferences.

data.title: Package search doesn't find rest-client even though it should
data.body:
With Atom 1.0.2 on OS X Yosemite.
I'm trying to install [rest-client](https://atom.io/packages/rest-client) but when I search for 'rest-client' in the settings pane or using apm it doesn't find the package. Trying to install directly with apm returns an error:

```
No available version compatible with the installed Atom version: 1.0.2
```

rest-client's package.json says it's compatible:

```
  "engines": {
    "atom": ">0.50.0"
  },
```

data.title: Nopaste with middle mouse button in linux (again)
data.body:
Refer from closed issue ( /cc @kevinsawicki )

  Nopaste with middle mouse button in linux. #2244 
  https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/2244
  "Please open new issues for any problems you see with the new middle mouse paste behavior."

With a clean install of

```
    node -v && npm -v
        v2.3.4
        2.12.1
    atom --version
        1.0.3-5566d54
```

on

```
    lsb_release -rd
        Description:    openSUSE 13.2 (Harlequin) (x86_64)
        Release:        13.2
```

There's, similarly, no middle-click paste in atom -- either of primary or clipboard contents.

No output in dev console on attempt -- just silent fail, no action.

data.title: git status column not updated after partial staging
data.body:
When staging and commiting some individual hunks of a file only, the git status in the line number column is not updated correctly. Closing and re-opening the file fixes the problem.

I'm using Atom 1.0.2 on Linux.

data.title: Dialog Box Inconsistency on Ubuntu
data.body:
**Atom 1.0.0** on _Ubuntu 14.04.2_
### The dialog box asking to save unsaved changes is not consistent with the rest of the system.
1. The dialog box doesn't highlight the header part, where the close icon ('x')
   is displayed.
2. The close icon ('x') is shown on the upper right corner. Whereas on Ubuntu
   these icons are generally shown on the upper left corner.
3. On Ubuntu, the affirmative actions (save, authenticate, yes) are shown on the
   right side of the dialog box. But Atom shows it on the left side.
4. The dialog box doesn't highlight the 'save' button with a different color.

![dialog-box-atom](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11135104/8634115/1dd3ca86-2809-11e5-9e89-2c88e340b781.png)
###### Dialog Box in Atom

![dialog-box-gedit](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11135104/8634119/294ae00c-2809-11e5-8e20-738691636640.png)
###### Dialog Box in gEdit

data.title: Undefined is not a  function
data.body:
Using the latest version on OSX (1.0.2), if I try to open atom I am presented with this error:

![screen shot 2015-07-11 at 14 36 51](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/298930/8633903/563f4a46-27da-11e5-8e3d-64a314764a9b.png)

The full stack trace is:

`TypeError: undefined is not a function
    at Object.module.exports.activate (/Users/Keva161/.atom/packages/terminal/lib/terminal.coffee:23:20)
    at Package.module.exports.Package.activateNow (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/package.js:240:19)
    at /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/package.js:221:30
    at Package.module.exports.Package.measure (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/package.js:165:15)
    at Package.module.exports.Package.activate (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/package.js:213:14)
    at PackageManager.module.exports.PackageManager.activatePackage (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/package-manager.js:452:21)
    at /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/package-manager.js:436:29
    at Config.module.exports.Config.transact (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/config.js:311:16)
    at PackageManager.module.exports.PackageManager.activatePackages (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/package-manager.js:431:19)
    at PackageManager.module.exports.PackageManager.activate (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/package-manager.js:412:46)`

If I open atom from the terminal by running `atom --safe` however, then it opens up without error.

data.title: Square bracket not working on Windows 7
data.body:
I've had this issue with pre-1.0 builds as well, but it doesn't seem to be fixed. Whenever I try to type in an opening square bracket, `[`, it doesn't show. The key does work, as `^` and `Â¨` do work. The closing bracket `]` does show up. Also in other programs this key works.

My keyboard layout is dutch azerty (not sure what the official name is), looking like this:

![2000px-belgian_pc_keyboard svg](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3522063/8633812/beb94984-27dd-11e5-9122-d692157ee207.png)

The blue letters have to be typed together with `Alt Gr`. I have already checked the keybindings that there is nothing overriding the combination, but can't really find an issue:

![altg](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3522063/8633821/009d5836-27de-11e5-96c2-9cd2fe5406d5.PNG)

Again, closing the square bracket works. Also other `Alt Gr` combinations work, such as `@`, `|`, `#`, `{`, `}`, `]`, ...

data.title: settings-view@0.211.2
data.body: This [removes the redundant updates container](https://github.com/atom/settings-view/pull/582) from the package detail view.

data.title: Feature Request: Add Find Previous Button on Ctrl-F
data.body:
In Atom v1.0, 
On Ctrl-F & selecting a term, one can find all the terms with "Find Next" option. 
Let's say i'm searching for the term "callback", there are over 200 results found in the code. Now i click "Find Next" for 5 times (5th term is the target, i need to modify it), If Accidentally, i click "Find Next" again for the 6th time (past the target), To go back to 5th Term, i need to either restart the search or click "Find Next" until i get back to target. Sublime provides a great option of doing that. Please add that feature to the atom.

data.title: Installer not working on Windows 8.1
data.body:
I tried to install Atom 1.0 after downloading it but when I click at the icon of the installer a window appear that shows Atom is being installed and when it disappeared there's nothing happened.

> I'm using windows 8.1 by the way.

data.title: Can't type backslash with Latam (Spanish) keyboard.
data.body:
While I was giving atom a try today, unfortunately I found it impossible to write down a single backslash with my current keyboard layout (Latam/Spanish).

I was trying to write down PHP namespaces but it was not possible unless I changed my keyboard to the English layout.

![latam-setting-backslash](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6007059/8632103/8235ad76-2752-11e5-9d8a-ad5b4a4db813.png)

data.title: Opening multiple files using Context Menu in Windows Explorer opens multiple instances
data.body: Opening multiple files using Context Menu in Windows Explorer opens multiple instances of Atom instead of opening all the files as tabs in the same instance. (Windows 7 x64)
